Dependable with dependable transportation
Valid driver's license and clean DMV record

Overview
Manage health and safety programs and compliance activities at JBT’s Madera and Riverside California facilities in a manner consistent with corporate policies and regulatory laws. Facilitate Risk management and environmental programs in close partnership with the Global HSE Manager.
 Responsibilities
Key Responsibilities:
  Safety Compliance -
Active leadership of safety program to promote safety, health, and industrial hygiene awareness.
Lead emergency response team, emergency plan, employee training, and facility evacuation drills.
Prepare and implement annual safety action plan to promote proactive safety program and continuous performance improvement.
Conduct annual assessment and inspections of personal protective equipment for all operations and certify compliance.
Conduct annual employee training on OSHA regulations and safe work behaviors.
Conduct safety training for new employees, temporaries, and contractors.
Maintain chemical inventory and SDS management system
Environmental Compliance –
Implement environmental management system to ensure compliance with environmental regulations.
Conduct waste, storm water and spill prevention control and countermeasure plan (SPCC) inspections in accordance with state and federal requirements.
Coordinate recycling and waste reduction activities.
Health Services -
Develop and implement annual plan for facility industrial hygiene program according to JBT guidelines.
Conduct industrial hygiene monitoring for applicable processes.
Ensure incident investigations and corrective actions are completed for all work related incidents.
Security & Risk Management -
Manage facility security including onsite guard program and facility access system.
Administer risk management program.
Maintain master list of approved facility contractors: approved training, insurance and drug policy.
Safety -
Coordinate annual inspection of fire protection equipment. Maintain inventory of equipment.
Provide customer support for all product safety concerns.
Ensure product manuals incorporate safe operation procedures.
Participate in inspections of equipment installations at customer locations for safe operational capabilities.
Assist product safety coordinator with conducting product safety incident investigations.
Meet all monthly safety requirements as established by the HSE Department
Manage annual budgetary requirements for the HSE Department
TRAVEL
Routine travel to Riverside California location
Periodic travel to customer locations throughout California
Infrequent travel to other JBT locations or customer locations around the world
  PHYSICAL DEMANDS
The work environment and physical demands described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Works in office environment approximately 70% of the time. Uses standard office equipment, related medical equipment, and industrial hygiene equipment.  Job requires exposure to hazardous waste, blood borne pathogens, and employee security. Works in shop/service environment 30% of the time, which involves exposure to moderate noise levels, and all shop machinery.  High stress position that requires walking, bending, climbing, stooping and moderate lifting daily. 
Qualifications
MANDATORY REQUIREMENTS
BS in Occupational or Environmental Health/Safety related field and 3+ years safety compliance and environmental experience.
Proficient in MS office applications (Word, Excel, Power Point)
Technical writing proficiency
PREFERRED REQUIREMENTS
MS in Occupational or Environmental Health/Safety related field
Primary equipment manufacturing experience
Certified Safety Professional
BENEFITS
  JBT Corporation offers the growth potential of a company with a developing technology that is unique in its field, plus frequent company-sponsored events and a competitive benefits package that includes medical, dental and vision coverage and 401(k) plan.
  AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
  It is the policy of JBT Corporation to provide equal opportunity for qualified persons and not to discriminate against any applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law at the JBT Corporation location to which this application is submitted. In addition, as a Federal Government contractor, JBT Corporation is an affirmative action employer. If you require accommodation during the application process, please contact the local Human Resources department. EOE-Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities
  If you have a disability or impairment that prevents you from completing the online application, please seek the assistance of your local employment services agency. JBT maintains active relationships with local employment services agencies, and they have pledged their support in assisting any applicant needing help in applying. To find information on agencies throughout the United States, please go to www.careeronestop.org
  You may also call Megan Meagrow at 844-286-4524 if your disability or impairment prevents you from applying online. NOTE: Do not use this number unless you need assistance because of a disability or impairment. The personnel attending this phone line will not be able to give you a status update regarding your application and will not be the individuals making a decision regarding your employment

We have multiple Inside Sales openings.
You will be working in our new constructed branch in Fresco, CA.
Are you a sales professional who can drive new business?
If you enjoy building relationships, talking to people and closing the deal, this may be the job for you!
As an Inside Sales Consultant, you will develop and maintain face-to-face relationships with customers by promoting products, providing day-to-assistance and generating sales for a building materials industry leader. From customers to contractors, you play an important role in recommending roofing materials and tools for projects of all sizes.
Job Description
Receive and process requests directly from customers (via telephone, fax and mail) for price quotations, product availability, orders, material returns, billing corrections, product information, order changes, and cancellations
Plan and implement telemarketing and prospecting objectives
Quickly and smoothly resolve customer complaints and problems

Coordinate delivery and/or pick up of customer orders with operations teams

Maintain adequate supply of product samples and literature

Work with Replenishers to achieve the best product line

Maintain adequate product stock at branch location
Responsible for setup and maintenance of store displays
Sustain a working technical knowledge of all available Allied products
Review job plans and bidding documents for Taper quotes and developing project summaries for Outside Sales personnel
Perform other duties as assigned
Requirements

Previous sales experience (building products industry preferred)

Must be able to learn and retain vast amounts of product information
Preferences
Experience in a team-based environment

Overview
Headquartered in Hilliard Ohio, Advanced Drainage Systems, Inc (ADS) is the leading manufacturer of high performance thermoplastic corrugated pipe, providing a comprehensive suite of water management products and drainage solutions.  Our innovative products and superior drainage solutions are used across a broad range of end markets and applications, including residential, non-residential, agriculture and infrastructure applications.  We have established a leading position in many of these end markets by leveraging our national sales and distribution platform, overall product breadth and scale, and our manufacturing excellence.  Founded in 1966, we operate a global network of 3,700 employees, 63 manufacturing plants and 31 distribution centers.  In July, 2014 we became a public company traded on the NYSE®.  To enable our continued growth, we are looking to add top talent to our dynamic organization.
Responsibilities
The Plant Maintenance Technician oversees and performs the preventive and reactive maintenance duties required for the manufacturing operations of the plant. Priorities of the Maintenance Technician include management and execution of PM schedules, repair of any equipment that is needed to maintain maximum production rates and maintenance of an adequate spare parts inventory. This position requires the flexibility to work 40+ hours per week, weekends as required and also fulfill on-call duties for repairs and assistance. The Plant Maintenance Technician reports directly to the Maintenance Manager or Production Manager and/or Plant Manager.
  The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:
    Practice proper PPE compliance and maintain a safe working record and environment
Maintain adequate inventories of spare parts and equipment
Immediately communicate unsafe conditions, acts or injuries to Plant Manager
Ensure that all equipment is kept in a proper and safe working condition
Practice proper forklift operation and preventive maintenance
Direct and perform scheduled Preventive Maintenance duties
Maintain facility housekeeping
Communicate with all plant personnel
Maintain and build job skills through company training programs
Communicate with ADS support services
Troubleshoot and repair equipment that is not operating properly
Assist with ADS support service team projects
Effectively manage UPTIME performance
Understand and practice ADS CORE VALUES
  Job Skills:
 This position should possess the following skills/knowledge:
   Basic industrial mechanical, electrical, plumbing and pneumatic skills including troubleshooting
Understand purpose and proper use of small hand and power tools
Understanding of ADS manufacturing process including troubleshooting
Strong time management and task prioritization skills
Inventory management
Self-motivation
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work with and communicate to other plant personnel
o    Facility organization
Basic computer skills
    Educational Requirements:                                          Preferred Experience:
    High School/Vocational School Diploma or equivalent
3-5 years experience as ADS line operator or similar training and experience
   Physical Requirements:
    The employee will lift and move heavy items, which will require the ability to repeatedly lift 75 pounds to a height of 6 feet
The employee will be working specified shifts and moving around at all times, which will require the ability to stand and be mobile for a minimum of 8 continuous hours
Facilities can be extremely hot or cold at times, so the employee must have the ability to perform physical labor for extended periods of time in temperature extremes
The employee will be handling materials daily, which requires the ability to use hands, arms and legs to physically handle and transport finished goods
 EEO Statement
Advanced Drainage Systems is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Company Overview
HD Supply (NASDAQ:HDS) ( www.hdsupply.com ) is one of the largest industrial distributors in North America. The company provides a broad range of products and value-add services to approximately 500,000 customers with leadership positions in maintenance, repair and operations and specialty construction sectors. Through approximately 260 locations across 36 states and six Canadian provinces, the company's approximately 11,000 associates provide localized, customer-driven services including jobsite delivery, will call or direct-ship options, diversified logistics and innovative solutions that contribute to its customers' success. With an active commitment to the communities in which we operate, HD Supply associates are part of a thriving organization that supports the virtues of wellness, diversity and inclusion – all of which are top priorities for the company. Equally as important is empowering our associates to grow professionally while providing competitive benefits and compensation. If you’re ready to find a rewarding career and achieve your full potential with a growing industry leader, HD Supply is ready for you!
Job Description & Qualifications
Job Summary
This is an entry-level cross functional program that develops employees for future roles as successful managers, accomplished outside sales professionals, and key operations personnel. This competitive program is designed to attract the very best talent. Participants will complete a program that includes rotational assignments in various segments of the branch business with on-the-job training. Program associates act as role models of professionalism, ethical behavior and utilize effective decision making at all times. Program associates must thrive on challenge and a changing environment, while demanding continuous learning in a competitive, fast paced environment.
Major Tasks, Responsibilities and Key Accountabilities
+ Participates in cross-functional job rotations in various areas of the company and in a variety of development related tasks including self-study, classroom learning, leadership development, mentor meetings, project management and other learning activities with the purpose of matching the individual with the opportunity that best matches interests, skills and abilities. + Utilizes learning programs to develop leadership, operations and/or sales knowledge within the branch/facility. + Achieves all training milestones or tollgates. + Experiences hands-on training needed to learn business systems and processes. + Learns key interfaces within each area of the business as well as company culture. + Represents our SPIRIT values in all interactions with associates, customers and suppliers; works effectively with branch and corporate personnel at all levels, consistently following all company policies and procedures. + Adds value to their assigned branch by participating in branch activities and completing assigned tasks in a timely manner and as directed.
Nature and Scope
+ Works in compliance with established procedures and/or protocols. Identifies and resolves readily identifiable, clearly defined problems. Demonstrates skill in data analysis, techniques by resolving missing/incomplete information, inconsistencies/anomalies in routine research/data. + Nature of work requires general supervision; exercises judgment. May be paired with a mentor. Work typically involves regular process checks or review of output by a coworker and/or supervisor. + May provide general guidance/direction to or train junior level support personnel.
Work Environment
+ Ability to lift and carry up to 50 lbs in a physical environment. Ability to stand for periods of time up to and exceeding 60 minutes. Ability to make repetitive movements including, but not limited to, using a 10-key or calculator, bending or squatting. + Typically in a comfortable environment but with regular exposure to factors such as temperature extremes, moving machinery, loud noise, and fumes, which may cause noticeable discomfort. + Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.
Education and Experience
+ Typically requires BS/BA in related discipline. Certification may be required in some areas. Generally 0-2 years of experience in related field OR MS/MA and generally 0-1 year of experience in related field.
Preferred Qualifications & Job Specific Details

General
Driven to succeed, competitive and goal achievement orientated Self-governed and take initiative Strong communication skills and comfortable conversing with team members and customers Energetic, positive attitude and outgoing personality Professional demeanor B.S. in Business (any discipline) or Construction Management and/or equivalent military experience Minimum 1-2 years' work experience Willing to relocate upon completing the program
Sales Focus
Enjoy interacting and spending time around other people Passion for partnering with customers to develop value added solutions
Operations Focus
Ability to use computer systems and apply knowledge to manage operations Experience leading or building a team Organized, attention to detail, and able to manage a schedule

THE ROLE
The Field Service Crew Lead will be part of Tesla’s Energy Operations and Maintenance (O&M) team. As a member of the this team, the Crew Lead will lead a team to successfully complete quality upgrades on PV systems. The Crew Lead is in command on a crew and will function as the overall lead on a job site. It is the responsibility of every team member to ensure safe work practices for Tesla’s O&M team. New hire training and continued training will be provided. 
  RESPONSIBILITIES
• Provide leadership and technical expertise to the Field Service team members
• Work with a team to; remove, upgrade, perform quality checks, re-install, and commission solar PV systems
• Ensure all related equipment necessary is available, onsite and cleaned up
• Communicate job status to the customer and leadership
• Document and update job status in the company database
• Lead efforts for safe work practices for the installation teams
• Attend weekly team meetings 
• Provide an exceptional customer experience to all customers throughout the process
• Additional duties required as needed
• Travel may be required
  REQUIREMENTS
• 3-5 years’ experience in roof work, general construction, or carpentry including 3 years of solar PV installation experience
• Minimum 6 months leading a crew of two or more 
• Understanding of the NEC codes that relate to solar PV installations
• Ability to lift 50 lbs.
• Ability to work in extreme environments (example: hot sun, cold, crawl spaces, etc.) 
• Capable of working at heights including on rooftops, climbing ladders and stairs; and performing repetitious duties, including lifting, bending and standing for long periods of time
• Experience using basic hand and power tools
• Basic computer skills
• Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Must have excellent customer service skills
• Excellent attendance is crucial for the team to achieve success
• Ability to work well with and lead others in a collaborative team environment
• Must be able to successfully pass pre-employment screening requirements

Looking for a place to grow your career? A place where you can work with industry recognized professionals who are solving tough environmental problems? Geosyntec is the place for you!  As an entry-level remediation geologist in our environmental sciences and engineering practice, you will apply your academic knowledge and practical experience to real-world situations related to contaminated site assessment & remediation, groundwater management, water treatment, and environmental due diligence while also learning and expanding the business skills needed for a successful consulting career. 
Our clients ask us to address their new ventures and most challenging problems involving the environment, natural resources, and civil infrastructure. Ranked by ENR in the top 20 design firms for the environment, Geosyntec is internationally known for its technical leadership, broad experience, and exceptional client service. Learn more by visiting www.geosyntec.com. 
ABOUT THE POSITION:
Is this the right position to help you achieve your professional goals? Some of the key responsibilities for the entry-level remediation geologist position may include:
Fieldwork such as soil and groundwater sampling, drilling and contractor oversight, construction quality assurance and oversight, and remediation system O&M;
Chemical data and contaminant fate & transport evaluation;
Groundwater and soil remedy evaluation, cost estimation, design calculations, and implementation;
Environmental due diligence, regulatory compliance services, and permitting;
Aquifer testing and hydrogeologic data analyses;
Data analysis, including preparing maps, tables, and figures; and
Preparation of technical reports, letters, memoranda, plans, specifications, and proposals. 
You should expect to work closely with experienced professionals who will guide and integrate you into Geosyntec’s culture, as you expand your career. Here are some other things you should know about a typical junior-level remediation geologist position with Geosyntec: 
Training: This position requires OSHA health and safety, first aid, and CPR training and medical monitoring, paid for by the firm. We also offer professional development opportunities including in-house seminars, webinars, and mentoring, that allow our professionals to build the technical and business skills necessary to become successful consultants.
Fieldwork: Up to 50%.
Overnight travel: Up to 50%.
Your success is our success. We encourage our professionals to continually develop their interests and skills. Advancement is based on an individual’s own performance and initiative. 
CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS:
BS degree in geology or related field. (required)
Advanced degree in geology or related field. (preferred)
Up to 2 years of related experience, including observation of drilling and well installation, soil sampling, groundwater sampling, and other field techniques. (preferred)
Knowledge of regulatory requirements related to environmental remediation. (preferred)
Prior internship experience in environmental consulting. (valuable)
Experience with construction work such as plumbing, electrical, structural, geotechnical, or mechanical tasks. (valuable)
Excellent writing and communication skills. (required)
Valid driver’s license and a satisfactory driving record. (required)
WHAT DOES IT TAKE TO BE SUCCESSFUL AT GEOSYNTEC?
Geosyntec strives to hire and retain the best and brightest people in their fields. We look for hard working individuals with exceptional interpersonal skills, communication skills, and problem-solving abilities, plus the passion for technical excellence and quality. We seek individuals with leadership potential, a commitment to lifelong learning and growth, and the desire to build a long and rewarding career with a growing Firm. 
WHY CHOOSE GEOSYNTEC?
Geosyntec is a great place to build a career. If you're looking for an exciting place to work, a place with challenging and rewarding projects, and a place that has been nationally recognized for its employees' quality of life, technical expertise, and business success, then Geosyntec may be the place for you. You can learn more about careers and employment at Geosyntec by visiting http://www.geosyntec.com/careers/ 
We are proud to offer our employees a highly competitive benefits package. Learn more by visiting http://www.geosyntec.com/careers/employee-benefits.

column2: Contract Administrator III (Procurement Specialist / Executive Assistant)
column5:
Kal Krishnan Consulting Services, Inc. (KKCS), a California Corporation, is a full-service engineering & design, construction management, and program management organization. The firm has grown steadily in size and capability since its founding in 1987, and today employs more than 85 professionals in our regional offices. KKCS has attracted to its staff a full complement of highly experienced, talented, and dedicated professionals who bring a collaborative, integrated team approach to our clients projects.
KKCS experience includes work on rail, airports, ports, freeways, schools, universities, facilities, water, wastewater, bridges, and roadways. Our client list includes federal agencies, state agencies, regional agencies, and private clients. KKCS has broad experience and expertise in engineering design, project management and project controls services.
The KKCS culture is rooted in the ideals of integrity, safety, diversity, and ethical business practices, which is a commitment shared by all KKCS employees throughout our offices and project sites around the country. We have a positive impact on the communities we serve by not only improving infrastructure but also providing service at a relatively low cost to the taxpayer. This allows for more money to be available to the agencies we serve, that inevitably will be reinvested in the community. At KKCS, we value the individual employee and the importance of their contributions toward quality improvement.
COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS
Company-paid medical, dental, and vision insurance for employees
401K retirement plan with company matching contribution
Paid holidays
Paid time off
Company-paid life and accidental death & dismemberment (AD&D) benefits
Company-paid long-term (LTD) insurance
Annual tuition assistance allowance for employees
Employee Assistance Program
Relocation allowance
POSITION DESCRIPTION SUMMARY
KKCS is seeking an experienced procurement specialist or executive assistant with a background in construction to join our team in Los Angeles, CA as a full-time Contract Administrator III. The Contract Administrator III provides high-level administrative support by conducting research, preparing and administering Request for Qualifications (RFQs) and Requests for Proposals (RFPs), handling information requests and performing clerical functions such as preparing contract documents and correspondence, arranging meetings and conferences as well as creating presentation materials. The position is anticipated to start in May 2018.
ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Prepares and administers RFQs and Requests for Proposals RFPs for design-build projects.
Tracks all Requests for Clarifications (RFCs) submitted during RFQ/RFP process, distributes them to appropriate parties for response; prepares, edits and issues all Addenda.
Coordinates pre-submittal conferences, interim interviews, proposer presentations, technical review sessions, proposal scoring sessions, debriefs and posts award meetings for RFQs and RFPs.
Reviews Statement of Qualifications submitted in response to RFQs for Design Build procurements, reviews initial proposals and Best and Final Offers submitted in response to RFPs for design-build procurements for responsiveness and conformity.
Prepares final contract documents, design-build RFQ, RFP, General Conditions and contract templates.
Prepares Proposed Board Actions (PBA) to request Board authorization to issue RFPs and contract award for design-build procurements.
Reviews and comment on PBA packages as they are submitted. Refers questions and comments to the appropriate college project team for correction or clarification.
Adjusts and edits the design-build procurement process and documents through legal research, lessons learned and coordination with Program Controls, Construction and Design.
Performs other tasks as needed, which may include historical document research, creating presentation materials, providing design-build training and presentations, etc.
Archives design-build project documents.
When duties and responsibilities change and develop, the job description will be reviewed and subject to changes of business necessity.
QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS
Required Experience
Five (5) to 10 years of experience working with California and Federal public procurement including alternate project delivery systems (design-build)
Experience in construction public works projects
Bachelor of Arts or Bachelor of Science degree
Proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Word, Adobe Acrobat
Ability to exercise judgment and discretion and to set priorities and manage competing demands
Demonstrate a reliable, responsive and positive work ethic with the highest degree of integrity
Excellent communications skills, both written and verbal
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
***PLEASE APPLY WITH RESUME***

Job Description
The Right-of-Way (ROW) Analyst/Specialist supports CAHSR by governing access to the rail right-of-way or other CHASR property by third party contractors, consultants, and other personnel. The ROW Coordinator manages the right-of-way and real estate records, permits, and databases as needed. This position is distinguished by responsibility for controlling CAHSR ROW and property access. Additionally the ROW Analyst/Analyst works with other departments and CAHSR Contractors for flagging services; and maintains records and databases of activities on and along the rail corridors.


• Knowledge of Local Right-of-Way Ordinance.

• Knowledge of Work Zone Safety procedures.

• Knowledge of Federal, State, and Local standards for Work Zone traffic control compliant devices.

• Skill in reviewing, evaluating, and modifying, construction plans.

• Skill in analyzing technical reports for compliance with material specifications.

• Skill in reviewing construction test results and preparing written reports.

• Skill in tracking and coordinating construction project status and inspections.

• Ability to make well-reasoned and timely decisions based on careful, objective review and informed analysis of available considerations and factors.

• Ability to identify existing and potential problems/issues.

• Obtains relevant information about the problem/issue, including recognizing whether or not more information is needed.

• Coordinate between DB design and the ROW task team

• Coordinate between DB and the ROW team to make sure that all the acquisition needs are addressed and met

• Liaison between the DB and the ROW for the transfer of parcels

• Identify critical parcels that affect the construction work

• Reporting back to the DB on the status of the ROW acquisition and responding to RFIs

• Help identify any “Permits to Enter” (PTE) needs if needed and determine whose responsibility

• Leads administrative activities and manages the right-of entry process for the District, this includes tracking, review, and issuing of Right-of-Entry Permits and Property Access Authorizations.

• Ensures contractor compliance with permit and property access authorization requirements.

• Leads administrative activities and manages the flagging process for the District, to include tracking, review and authorizing rail support services, requests, and coordination of flagging resources with CAHSR's rail services contractors.

• Maintains real estate records, including computer data bases, spatial (GIS) data, and document files, and prepares reports on real estate matters.

• Drafts real property access agreements, and invoices in accordance with District policies and procedures.

• Functions as the primary liaison between the CAHSR and third parties concerning right-of-way activities.

• Researches and advises CAHSR departments and staff on Right-of-Way access issues and agreements.

• Provides input on real estate department procedures.

• Coordinates with CAHSR departments on invoicing and data management as it relates to right-of-entry and right-of way activities.

• Prepares written correspondence and reports on ROW matters.

• Perform other related duties as assigned.
 

Required Qualifications

• At least (5) years performing Right of Way coordination work.

• Demonstrate increasingly responsible experience in the public sector in permit administration, rail right-of-way coordination, rail maintenance or rail construction or related field.

• Bachelor's Degree in business administration, engineering, planning, public administration, real estate, or a related field.

• Possess and maintain a California driver's license, Class C, and a satisfactory driving record for the last five years.

Why Choose Arcadis
Arcadis is the leading global design and consulting firm for natural and built assets, and we invite you to join us in partnering with our clients to deliver truly exceptional and sustainable outcomes. Contribute to the world’s most high-profile and transformative projects, from shopping centers in Shanghai and improved traffic flow in Atlanta to state-of-the-art rail systems in Doha, coastal defenses for Manhattan and cleaner air in Los Angeles.

Work alongside the industry’s foremost thought leaders and accomplished professionals, generating effective, real-world results. We are Arcadis: 27,000 people in more than 70 countries, creating value by applying our collective wisdom to every challenge. Our culture is collaborative, we believe in diversity and the power of global teamwork, and we own the responsibility to sustain the Earth and its people in a safe and balanced way.

Arcadis. Improving quality of life.

About This Business Line
Transportation, quite literally, makes the world go around. But rapidly increasing urbanization, shrinking budgets and sensitivity to the natural environment demand an innovative approach to advance the future of mobility in all its forms and functions. Join us in developing advanced infrastructure while helping our clients get the most from their existing assets – through innovation and transformational thinking. Together, we will solve some of the world’s most complex transportation and land development challenges. Help meet the demands of tomorrow – today.

As a Senior Estimator on our California High Speed Rail CP 2-3 project you will be initially based out of our Selma, CA project office and play a key role in the project’s successful execution. Ideally you will have had experience working on similar capacity major civil infrastructure projects.  
The Senior Estimator will support and work with design and operations team staff in the review of project plans, requirements and specifications. The Estimator shall perform quantity take-offs, pricing, and bidding of construction projects and have extensive knowledge of construction costs and engineering principles.
Responsibilities
Review project plans, requirements, and specifications.
Have demonstrated leadership abilities to coordinate with the team and estimators to develop a large multidisciplinary estimate.
Determine labor and equipment costs.
Prepare accurate quantity takeoffs and materials pricing.
Review and understand all bid documents and assess project risks.
Understand project logistics and project schedule.
Compare and analyze competitive subcontractor and supplier bids.
Review quotes and estimates with the Project Management Team.
Prepare estimates at different levels of completion (conceptual, Schematic, DD, CD, etc.)
Meet with Clients, Owners, and Engineers.
Serve as company interface between Owner - Architect/Engineer -DUSA Team and is responsible for developing leadership, motivation, and communication with owners, subcontractors and project team and is accountable for their actions.
Performs other related duties as required and assigned
Assist in preparation of bid schedules of projects being estimated
Perform Risk and Contract Management responsibilities as required
Review and incorporate historical data from purchase orders, subcontracts, productivity analysis reports, etc. into unit and man-hour figures
Prepare discipline estimates by calculating complete takeoff of scope of work
Advise on major changes in scope of work.
Upon project completion, conduct debriefing with estimating, engineering and production teams to discuss positive and negative aspects of the project
Maintain files of working documents as back-up for estimate figures, including current/accurate information on prices from suppliers and subcontractors
Search and analyze options for most effective means and methods of construction
Understand best value approach to winning new work
Set productive, consistent, and acceptable work example
Maintains knowledge of Flatiron’s company values and strategic plan
Support published corporate policies
Perform additional assignments per management’s direction
Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in a related field from an accredited institution and 5 years estimating or related experience.
10 years related experience if not degreed in a related field of study.
Minimum 2 years of Structures or Earthwork Estimating for heavy civil projects. (Highway, Rail, Bridge or Airport infrastructure)
Experience with HCSS Heavy Bid Estimating Software preferred
To understand and consider in the estimate construction specifications and contract requirements
INDH

Company:
CableCom is a leading provider of engineering, construction, and testing services for coaxial and fiber optic cable systems. With headquarters in Bothell, Washington, just outside of Seattle, we have 17 locations throughout the Western Region of the US. Founded in 1978, CableCom is a subsidiary of Dycom Industries – one of the largest telecommunication infrastructure companies in the U.S., with approximately 14,000 employees and over 40 subsidiaries.
Every day at CableCom, we work to improve the way information is shared and communicated through the execution of innovative technology projects. Join us in Fresno, California, where you can be a part of a team dedicated to providing world class customer service.
Overview:
Experienced Aerial Lineman needed in our Fresno, California office for CATV work with knowledge of lashing cable and fiber, complete pole transfers and storm damage. Splicing coax cable, bucket truck and/or and Digger truck experience a plus! Candidate must be capable of working in all temperatures, climates and weather conditions and be able to pass background and drug screen. We offer competitive pay and an extensive benefits package.
Responsibilities:
Supervise and/or direct the daily work performed by 3 to 4 man crew. This includes ensuring that all needed tools and equipment are available at the jobsite, assigning work to the crew members in the field, working from engineered blue prints, and completing all necessary paperwork to track and bill for the work performed.
Install aerial and underground cables and/or support members in conformance with all applicable codes, regulations, and customer specifications ( NEC Electrical Code, System and/or City Specifications).
Climb utility poles and/or use aerial lift truck to place cables on poles per system design.
Assure that door-tagging and resident notification of our construction activities has been completed prior to starting each workday. Resolve customer/resident complaints related to construction activities performed by crew working under your supervision.
Ensure daily inspection and maintenance of fleet vehicles and equipment assigned to crew working under your supervision is performed and documented. If appropriately licensed, drive company vehicles as needed to jobsite.
Qualifications:
Possess a valid driver’s license (Class “C” minimum) or be eligible and willing to acquire any needed drivers license (including “commercial class” license).
Capable of working in all temperatures, climates, and weather conditions.
Willingness to work shifts as assigned, including daily overtime whenever necessary and at the discretion of supervisors.
Ability to performing demanding tasks and heavy physical labor as assigned for the duration of the daily shift.
Must be a “certified pole climber” or capable of demonstrating proficiency as a pole climber.
Must own all hand tools and climbing gear required to perform the daily functions of this position.
Must be able to pass background and drug screen.
Standing - 6 to 8 hours daily
Walking - 6 to 8 hours daily
Climbing - 6 to 8 hours daily
Driving throughout day
Bending & Twisting - 6 to 8 hours daily
Pushing & Pulling - 6 to 8 hours daily
Repetitive Motions (grasping, manipulating) - 4 to 5 hours daily
Lifting Heavy Objects (100 lbs.) - Occasionally
Lifting Medium Objects (50 to 90 lbs.) - Often
Lifting & Carrying Objects (50lbs for up to 100 yards) – Regularly
Benefits Include
Competitive Pay
Health Insurance: Medical, Dental, Vision and Prescription Plans
Flexible Spending Accounts
Retirement Savings Plan (401K) with company matching
Stock Purchase Plan
Short & Long Term Disability
Supplemental Life and AD&D Insurance
Paid Holidays and Vacation (PTO)

When you apply for this job, you will be asked to answer questions regarding your criminal background. Answering “Yes” to the criminal background questions will not automatically bar you from employment. A criminal background check will be conducted following any conditional offer of employment. Only those crimes which are substantially related to the position you are seeking will be considered. Please note that for certain contractors with whom we do business, based on the nature of their operation, the type of offense and related factors may affect your assignment to that contractor. Factors that will be taken into account include: (1) The facts or circumstances surrounding the offense or conduct; (2) the number of offenses for which you were convicted or plea was entered; (3) your age at the time of conviction or plea, or release from prison; (4) any evidence that you performed the same or similar type of work, post conviction/plea, with the same or different employers, with no known incidents of criminal conduct; (5) the length and consistency of employment history before and after the offense or conduct; (6) any rehabilitation efforts, e.g. education/training; (7) any employment or character references and any other information regarding your fitness for the particular position; and/or (8) whether you are bonded under a federal, state, or local bonding program.

Description:
FIELD SUPERVISOR
EFCO Corp. has an exciting opportunity for a Concrete Form Carpenter to serve as a Field Supervisor based out of our Fresno, CA District Office. This is an exciting opportunity that offers professional growth and development, year-round job stability, and the opportunity to be part of the team that is taking concrete forming technology to the next level!
This position provides on-site instruction in the assembly, application and cycling of EFCO Corp.\'s forming systems and identifies the best solution to meet customer needs while ensuring safety and productivity standards are met. Must have knowledge and understanding of concrete forming products.
Duties:
Assists with the erection of forming equipment on job site. Handles irregularities as needed and consistently reviews and ensures product saftety guidlines are met. Helps customers with cycling procedures of formwork. Completes a fact sheet for every job site visited.
Identifies best solution for customer, working with district and corporate personnel. Acts as a troubleshooter, recognizing potential problems and coaches customers as needed.
Completes field service scheduling reqirements. Reviews blueprints and pre-plans for best practices. Counts equipment ensuring mistakes are caught, works with sales and engineering staff to determine needs.
Works as sales partner with Territory Manager to create customer solutinos prior to the sale by demonstrating initial cycling of forms with contractors.
Delivers a minimum of two safety toolbox meetings on customer job-site per month.
Performs other job-related duties and special projects as required.
Qualifications:
FIELD SUPERVISOR
Successful Field Supervisors have had form carpentry, foreman, superintendent, construction management and other construction profession backgrounds. Hands on experience with concrete forms a must. Experience with EFCO forms is a plus!
High school diploma or equivalent, plus minimum 5 years foreman or superintendent experience or Bachelor\'s of Engineering degree. Carpenter union member helpful. Blueprint reading required. Excellent communication, decision making and leadership skills required. Must be a creative thinker, motivated with the ability to resolve problems quickly. Needs to have a passion for construction an dconsistently demonstrate a positive attitude. Demonstrates the ability to answer technical questions. Must be able to perform high levels of customer service while enduring full satisfaction when equipment is delivered.
Physical requirements: Candidates must be able to drive for extended periods of time as well as sit/stand for unlimited intervals. Position includes constant climbing and maneuvering around objects including working above head. Must be able to lift, push and pull up to 50 lbs. Extensive travel (2-4 nights per week).Final candidates will be required to pass a post-offer pre-employment physical and drug screen.
EOE
We participate in E-Verify.

Welcome to TETER, Central California's largest architecture and engineering firm. For four decades we've been partnering with clients to design beautiful, safe, and sustainable buildings, vibrant learning environments, and meaningful public places. Whether it's breathing life into an older building or designing new construction, our Architectural Team listens to our clients' wishes and concerns, then works within their budget to develop a solution they'll enjoy for years to come.
We're currently looking for an Design Professional to join our growing team in Fresno. This is the perfect opportunity for someone with a year or two of practice in a design firm, looking to gain valuable experience in a multidisciplinary firm. You'll work with experienced architects and project managers, and providing drafting support on a variety of education and public sector projects.
The successful Design Professional must be able to adhere to the Firm's high standards of quality and performance; collaborate with team members across disciplines; follow instructions thoroughly; and grasp concepts with a high attention to detail.
Minimum requirements for this position include:
Bachelor's degree in Architecture, Construction or a related field;
Two to four years of experience in a professional architecture environment in California or working on projects that have California Building Code requirements;
Experience using REVIT including preparing construction documents and 3D modeling;
NCARB registration and in pursuit of California Architect license, including the progression of reported AXP (IDP) hours and Architectural Record Exams (ARE); and
Compensation is based on experience. Traditional benefits include medical, dental, employee-paid vision, Cafeteria plan, and 401k, all taking effect on the 1st of the month following the date of employment. TETER also offers multiple benefits to help employees maintain positive work-life balance and a healthy lifestyle.
Professional development benefits include regularly-scheduled training opportunities, support for licensure, Buddy Program, Mentoring Program, and more!
------------------------------------------------------------
TETER, LLP, has been serving a variety of public and private sector clients for nearly four decades. Our high-quality results come from exceptional performance, supportive relationships, and ongoing career development. We provide the tools and resources you need to thrive, as well as excellent benefits and fun rewards. It's the perfect combination for a successful career. Sound like a place you'd like to be?

 Production and maintenance of working and presentation drawings using CAD coordination of engineering and architectural disciplines on a project basis. Assist with the plan check process, coordination of outside consultants, and special projects as assigned.

Highly motivated

Team player

Dock Attendant
Marina Harbor Anchorage
Marina del Rey 

E & S Ring Management has a fantastic opportunity for an individual to join our team as the Marina Dock Attendant and work with us at our 320+ boat slips community located in Marina del Rey!  You will be responsible for the completion of general maintenance tasks and repairs around the marina docks and boat slips, including but not limited to, overall cleanliness of the docks, trash removal, and other special projects as needed. 1 year prior boating (power and/or sail) experience.  Not necessary, but desired.

The Company and the Role:
Lehigh Hanson is one of the largest construction materials companies in North America with more than 550 active operations in the U.S. and Canada. Our core activities include the production and distribution of cement and aggregates, the two essential raw materials in concrete. Lehigh Hanson companies also produce ready-mixed concrete, asphalt and other concrete products.

Lehigh Hanson is part of the HeidelbergCement Group, a global leader in aggregates, cement, concrete, and other downstream activities. The Group employs over 60,000 people at more than 3,000 locations in 60 countries.

Lehigh Hanson is seeking a qualified Quality Control Technician for theCalaveras and South Valley Materials plant locations to be based out of Sanger, CA.

This opportunity is perfect for the professional who is looking to grow their career with an industry leader. As the Quality Control Technician, you will have the opportunity to learn about a stable industry as you work within an established quality control program with a tenured and knowledgeable team. This is a unique opportunity for you to begin your career with a proven leader in the aggregate, ready mix concrete, hot mix asphalt, and construction materials industry.

Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Female / Veteran / Disabled

What you’ll get to do:
Sampling and testing of Aggregate Production and Shipped Materials
Monitoring and testing of incoming aggregate shipments to the Ready Mixed Concrete plants.
Performing moisture content testing on the sand and aggregates and verification / calibration ofReady Mixed ConcretePlant Moisture Meters.
Becoming ACI Certified and sampling concrete for internal QC testing of various concrete mixes.
Performing Strength Testing of sampled Concrete and reporting the results to the QC Manager for mix history development.
Providing Field Supervision and Monitoring of on-going projects as needed.
Ensure compliance with all health, safety, and environmental legislation, regulations, and company policies and procedures. Report any unsafe condition, accidents or incidents to supervisor immediately.
Maintain work area in a clean, organized, and safe manner.
Will be required to work some Saturdays, Nights / Early Mornings.
Regular and on-time attendance.
Other duties as assigned.
Who we are looking for:
High school diploma or general education degree (GED) preferred.
Strong ability in performing mathematical calculations.
Prior experience in the ready mix concrete laboratory testing is required.
ACI Field Grade 1 Sampling Technician required, though it may be expired.
ACI Laboratory Strength Testing Technician preferred but not required
Proficient with computer and software databases, primarily MS Office (Excel, Word, etc.), and Kronos Timekeeper.
Experience in resolving problems and dealing with difficult situations.
Ability to understand oral and written instructions relating to job duties
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Demonstrated ability to be self-directed, with minimal supervision.
Demonstrated commitment to continuous improvement.
Ability to repeatedly lift up to 50 lbs.
Benefits & Compensation:
We appreciate that candidates have many questions when considering opportunities, so we want to let you know that we offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package, which we like to share with candidates a little bit later in the process.

No search firms please.

We are in search of an Installation Technician who will become a strong contributor and make a difference.  In the Installation Technician role, you will be working with a crew to install residential solar systems in a timely manner.  
Key Job Duties:
Work with a team to install the racking system and solar panels on residential roofs
Maintain a high quality of installation
Prepare trucks for installs in the upcoming day making sure everything is neat and organized
Service the solar system as needed
Clean and prepare trucks at the end of the day to ensure that the vehicle is ready for the next day’s use
Occasional work in the warehouse organizing equipment
Maintain compliance to all PPE and safety regulations per OSHA and Vivint Solar standards
Perform other needed job tasks as requested by leadership
Necessary Skills and Experience:
1 to 2 years of relevant experience
Working knowledge of solar installation, construction and/or roofing
Ability to work well with others that are on your team
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to keep a positive attitude
Ability to be comfortable being and working on roofs
1 to 2 years experience installing residential solar systems
 Employees of Vivint Solar must submit to a criminal history check, motor vehicles check, drug screening, and obtain clearance from the state based upon the state requirements.

THE ROLE
The Field Service Associate will be part of Tesla’s Energy Operations and Maintenance (O&M) team. As a member of the this team, the Field Service Associate will work cooperatively with a team to successfully complete quality upgrades on PV systems.  It is the responsibility of every Field Service Associate to ensure safe work practices for Tesla’s O&M team. New hire training and continued training will be provided. 
  RESPONSIBILITIES
• Remove solar PV system
• Upgrade system and perform quality checks
• Re-install and commission system 
• Prepare and clean-up job site
• Work with the warehouse team to pull materials for each installation job
• Attend weekly team meetings 
• Provide an exceptional customer experience to all customers throughout the process
• Additional duties required as needed
• Travel may be required
  REQUIREMENTS
• Minimum 1 year experience in roof work, general construction, or carpentry required
• Experience installing solar PV systems strongly preferred
• Ability to lift 50 lbs.
• Ability to work in extreme environments (example: hot sun, cold, crawl spaces, etc.) 
• Capable of working at heights including on rooftops, climbing ladders and stairs; and performing repetitious duties, including lifting, bending and standing for long periods of time
• Experience using basic hand and power tools
• Basic computer skills preferred 
• Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Must have excellent customer service skills
• Excellent attendance is crucial for the team to achieve success
• Ability to work well with others in a collaborative team environment
• Must be able to successfully pass pre-employment screening requirements

Minimum of 5 years’ experience in support of design-build or heavy civil construction testing, inspection, supervision or management in support of large public works projects.
An understanding and experience with contract specifications as they apply to quality control and/or assurance, concrete mix designs, construction submittals, testing procedures, Microsoft Word, and inspection of concrete steel reinforcement and form work on bridge decks, beams, box culverts, columns, footings, utilities and roadway is a definite advantage, as are ACI and other quality related certifications.
A high school diploma or GED certification is required.
